Q2. If the damping ratio value is zero, then the pole location is:

answers.a: Outside of the unit circle in the z-plane

questions.question: Q3. What is the behavior of the pole if the natural frequency increases from zero with a constant damping ratio?

answers.a: Radially moving away from the origin of the S-plane in the left half
answers.b: Moving away from the imaginary axis in right half of the S-plane
answers.c: Moving closer toward the imaginary axis of the S-plane
answers.d: Moving closer toward the real axis of the S-plane

questions.question: Q4. What is the behavior of the poles in the Z-plane if the damping ratio increases from 0, while the natural frequency remains constant in the S-domain?

answers.a: Poles move towards the unit circle from inside in the Z-plane
answers.b: Poles move away from the unit circle towards the origin in the Z-plane
answers.c: Poles move towards the unit circle from outside in the Z-plane
answers.d: Poles remain on the unit circle in the Z-plane and rotate along a circular path

questions.question: Q5. What is the behavior of the poles in the Z-plane if the damping ratio is zero and the natural frequency varies in the S-plane?

answers.a: Poles remain on the unit circle in the Z-plane and rotate along a circular path
answers.b: Poles remain on the imaginary axis in the Z-plane
answers.c: Poles move towards the unit circle from outside in the Z-plane
answers.d: Poles move towards the unit circle from inside in the Z-plane
